Author: Mlich
Title: AUGMENTORS GAME Augmented Reality Mobile Gaming iOS Android Token DTB Databits
Body: Really great to be working with you Vintage   As he's mentioned, Telegram is in works. We will send out public invites once we've managed to formalise things a bit more with the channel and the new mods.  A few rapid-fire updates from the team:  1/4) There were a few concerns raised with the visual changes coming to some creatures and we just wanted to explain our reasoning. We’ve been adding some extra detailing and polishing work and, in some cases, the changes were to make the modelling and animation perform better. Some creatures, for example, have short limbs which makes for uninspiring rigging. Additionally, some of these changes are to better align the creature appearance to their home-realm. So, while dark and grungy has been the theme so far (and we’re not getting rid of it), we’ll also be aiming for a greater variety of light/dark creatures depending on their history and origin. Tidus is the most extreme change as we felt he was looking far too similar to Lionaire. See the Anta face-lift below.    2/4) The latest iOS release has introduced ARKit and boy are we EXCITED. They’ve really notched up what is possible on AR and it’s going to bring a lot to Augmentors. We’ve also been taking a look at ARCore and it’s looking promising too.  3/4) The new website will be launching next month. We don’t want to say too much yet but we can’t wait to show it off.  4/4) Last but most certainly not least, we’d like to take the time to introduce our new team of Mods! VintageBazaar, ViciousDad, Sarutobi and BBristow79 will be joining Adam and working closely with Slade to grow and develop the community, as well as swinging their banhammers on the spammers that have been infiltrating Slack channels crypto-wide.  Have a great weekend and, as always, Keep Battling!

Author: VintageBazaar
Title: AUGMENTORS GAME Augmented Reality Mobile Gaming iOS Android Token DTB Databits
Body: Hello all,  As most of you know, I am currently in South Africa, Cape Town.  Has a epic flight almost 24hrs travelling to get here and what a amazing country!  I wanted to give a update here also, just to note, many updates are being made in the Augmentors official telegram group.  So please join today and keep up to date with all developments.  I met with theAugmentors team yesterday at their HQ in Cape town, beautiful big building with views out of this world.  We had a productive 2.5hr meetings and a lot was mentioned.  I have signed a NDA (non disclosure act) so can't go into much detail, but I can share the following.  A lot of hard work has gone into the use case for databits, this has been a long and hard thought out process, thankfully the team have the first class experience of James, who works for Newtown partners and himself and others come up with what I would consider a ideal solution.  There are many legal requirements, not only in crypto but also concerning apple and Android store, so it was no easy task to work out a solution that benefits the game, the holders of dtb and most importantly one that is in line with all laws and regulations, so I am happy to say, it all looks solid, nothing to worry about, especially with recent events on Bittrex, dtb is fully in line with all rules and laws.  Then I had the privilege to meet the team developing the game and quite simply WOW.  A first class team, highly skilled and very passionate about their work,we are in very safe hands.  I am very happy with the progress that has been made, the team have brought Augmentors game into the future, they have really nailed the look and feel of the game. Author: SladeZA
Title: AUGMENTORS GAME Augmented Reality Mobile Gaming iOS Android Token DTB Databits
Body: Hi everyone, I'm Slade, the new Community Manager for Augmentors. While so far our comms have been focussed on Slack, I thought I'd start by copying some feedback over here:  "Regarding the timelines shared last week, @svenpetter was spot on when he mentioned the game mechanic change was a big setback.  We have had to go back to the drawing board, and reassess our current situation. Although it is does not seem like good news, we are in a much better place and I know we will deliver a really good game that will increase the long term value of Databits.  I am very sad to see Vintage Bazaar leave, judging by the feedback I’ve seen, he was a very important member of the community. Gert, our CEO, has reached out to him and I have attached the letter below.  Like I mentioned before, I’m really excited to be working on Augmentors. I completely understand the frustration that you, our backers, have been experiencing and I’m here to help fix that. Your voice and opinion is invaluable to us.  I’ve seen quite a few questions regarding my credentials and suppose it’s not unusual for some of you to be asking so let me tell you all a bit about myself.  I studied a Business Administration degree in Brand Building and Management and have worked at performance digital marketing agencies.  I have also been actively involved in the cryptocurrency space for almost 6 months, spending every spare minute studying and learning everything I can.  I’m an avid gamer and player of logic puzzles. I can solve a Rubik’s Cube in under a minute and regularly play Minesweeper. I am currently playing Battlefield 1, Overwatch and occasionally League of Legends (don’t hate, I’ve been playing since beta). My greatest gaming claim to fame is having held Rank 3 Battlefield 4 pilot in South Africa for a period and also having been one of the highest level Pokemon Go players in the country during the first two months (promise I’ll keep future non-Augmentors gaming talk to #random)  I like to think my skills put me in a position to really help us achieve our goal of making the most kickass mobile game out there. It’s not something that’s going to happen overnight but I truly believe we can make happen if we all work together.  So please, keep the feedback coming. We are listening. And if you have any questions, don’t be shy to ask "    "Hi everyone,  An open letter to @vintagebazaar below:  I hope you are doing well? Quite a bit has transpired since our last conversation.  I was not aware of previous promises made to you regarding community management, and apologize for the expectation that this set. Unfortunately the community management position is not on the cards as this would be a conflict of interest. I do however hope I can convince you to rejoin the community, and do so in a more formal capacity.    @viciousdad suggested getting you down to Cape Town to meet the team, have a beer and see what we are up to. Would you be open to this? We’d like to fly you down and think it would help restore your faith in the team and project. If you accept a more formal role in the community, a visit would give you lots to share.  I understand from the community that you have put in a lot of effort, and I hope it will not be in vain. Let me know when we can discuss specifics?  Regards, Gert"

Body: Great, thank you for the replies guys, over whelming vote for Telegram.   I will reach out to the Augmentors Team and put the suggestion forward to them. I’m sure they will be happy to have another source to help build the community. As you have seen from the open letter written by Augmentors Game CEO, i will be travelling to their headquarters in Cape Town, most likely by the start of October, so i will be able to ask popular questions people may have for the team, in person. It is my mission and long-term goal, to help Augmentors Game grow far and wide within the Crypto community, a community when kept informed, when kept up to date can make great headway in helping this project reach the masses. Author: Cryptarded
Title: AUGMENTORS GAME Augmented Reality Mobile Gaming iOS Android Token DTB Databits
Body: It would be nice for the new "CEO" to introduction himself on here and at very least the new community manager to introduction himself.  I posted this on the slack and hoping we get at least some decent feedback.  "I'm an ICO investor and I was a little shocked to see Vintage go which worried me. I decided to wait and see what the new CEO and community leader would do and I'm not liking their response. CEO gives us a vague roadmap of release for the pre-alpha, alpha, beta, and then game............. Realistically the game is a year to 1.5years out. I think at this point as an investor we should have a deadline for at least pre-alpha. Initially that was suppose to be out end of june/beginning of july. I understand projects have road blocks and problems come up but we should get a little more info than what you're giving us.   Then you announce @slade as the community manager which I'm ok with but none of his credentials are mentioned or how he'll be a valuable asset to the team. For all I know he's just some noob. Please explain why @slade was chosen as community leader and at least his background.  At this point I feel like we are getting a lot of FUD over the last month. It Would be nice to have our community leader talk to us and convince us why he's the best for the job. Also get a real roadmap that we can hold the team accountable for. It's the simple things that can make something like this game grow. I'm a huge databits backer and I want to see this game reach it's full potential. It's going to change the way games are played.   In all honestly I would like to know why Vintage wasn't thought about as the community manager. He could have saved your team a lot of headaches.........."

Author: VintageBazaar
Title: AUGMENTORS GAME Augmented Reality Mobile Gaming iOS Android Token DTB Databits
Body: Thank you...  Thanks to everyone for the kind words of support, been really amazing to see and read. I was not going to post here again, hell, I spent yesterday removing my posts here, ive never done that before, I cant express how much I feel stabbed in the back by the Augmentors Team, so I will mention a few things to give you a idea and understanding as to why I could no longer support the project.  As many people know, I was a ICO investor and been highly involved in helping other investors and community members here, since day 1. I had a big passion for the project and was doing my best every day, 7 days a week, to keep the positive vibe up in the Slack chat, I put in countless hours, trying to build the community, thinking of all kinds of way to help promote the project and get as much public attention to it as possible, to which everything was all going good, the Devs were actively giving us updates, showing us animations of the creatures, showing us artwork and cards for the creatures, all kinds.  Then things started to go quiet.  I used to speak with Kyle on skype, probably once a fortnight, as I was one of the biggest investors and clearly devoted to the game with all the hard work and hours spent helping the community he would give me little updates, which was great, it is the little things like that, that fuels the fire that drives the passion.  Then… about 2 months ago, everything began to get quiet, the little communication I now had with Kyle, I was constantly trying to explain how important the community is, how we should not be “Left in the Dark” and how valuable we are to the project, how we  can help greatly with the building of a strong community and also by offering our services and skills, most likely for free ,to help any other way we could with the game…  All Kyle would ever tell me is "its up to marketing" this is the reason "stone wall" reply he would give when i was asking for them to give something to you guys, some little update, a creature development, screen shot, just something... but same old and tired reply "i will see what marketing says" ..  Well, where is marketing? Who is this marketing team, who, wont allow the Augmentors game to release any info? Seriously? They must be the worst marketing team on the planet if they think holding back information from a community is a clever idea.  You know how frustrating this was to hear.  Sadly and painfully clear, all my advice was falling on deaf ears, i have nearly 4 yrs in Crypto and seen many projects come and go and a lot of the other members who have left had a vast knowledge and could have really helped keep momentum rolling and spirits high even in these quiet times, as long as there was just a small bit of help from the dev team, i was not asking for much, fine have updates only twice a month, but please give the community something to "chew on" as i said above, provide a screen shot or two or some animation of a new creature, anything so we could see work was being done and developments were progressing along.  Now we are at this horrible point, where the community is feeling battered and bruised and kicked to the kirb.  I am absolutely furious, how this was left to happen,  Myself and to be fair, at the start ,Adam from Tokenly, helped to build a great  community,  the choice to go almost silent from the Devs, they let it all crumble, to fall apart and left to die.  Just check the twitter account and Facebook, not a single post for nearly 2 months, it does not take 2mins to make a tweet or facebook post, hell, could do it sitting on the toilet, instead of letting the community go down the toilet. There's only so many times a person can ask for help, i felt like i was treading water, calling out to the captain of the boat to throw me a life ring, to keep me afloat, to help others around me, but in the end, i was left to drown.  Then, the final straw that broke this donkeys back, I learn from the new CEO who I spoke with about a week ago, for 30mins, that there was going to be a new community manager.  The Devs actions  of the last few months have pretty much killed the community, so there is hardly a community left to manage and now they are going to bring in some unknown person, that they think this person is going to help the community, how sadly wrong they are.  With the talks I had with Kyle, it was mentioned several times that he was pushing for me to be community Manager, i mentioned how id love to be officially named as the Community Manager since i had been in the role un-officilay since day 1. Now, I don’t know if he said this to keep me “happy” until they got someone else in, but clearly that’s how it looks.   A lot of people wanted to see me as the Community Manager and I would of done a far better job than Kyles mate will do. Clearly it is a friend of the Devs who took the job, often in life, the “Right man” gets screwed over, due to the Boss's friend getting the job. So be it.  Would have been nice to hear it from Kyle and not from the CEO, who id never spoken to before, someone who i thought was listening also to my advice, but clearly as we have seen in the last few days, simply does not care.    Lets rewind a bit, to the earlier days when I was talking with Kyle, he was telling me how they had this big Esports company , he really made it sound like it was one of the well-known companies and that big deals were being made and how they have this amazing Esports advisor to take them into the future…. Well, scroll back about 10 page and you will see .. Marshal Longs face. Serial Crypto scammer, who, if it was not for some other community members bring it to my attention, then myself pushing Kyle and Vinny to look into this person, he would still be advising Augmentors Game. Yeah, I should of know then, I put it down to a “noob mistake” on their side..  Clearly, the team, got what they wanted from the Crypto community, the ICO Bitcoins.  You have all served your purpose here, so move along nothing, like, really nothing to see here anymore.  For the record, Kyle did not even message me to ask why i left, he must have a guilty  conscious and is probably to ashamed to speak with me now. Also, i had not  sold a single $DTB in all the time i was helping the team, for some stupid reasoning, (this was another excuse i was given for the lack of updates) they believed most people here were just in it for the money and did not care about the project.  Well Kyle or any of the team who are reading this and previous comments, how sadly wrong you are, clearly a lot of people here has a passion for the project, not all people in crypto are in it for the money. There are a lot of great people who i have met in Crypto, many who supported the project and  looking forward to being on the journey to see the final, finished developments and play the game. I was really looking forward to showing the game to my son and telling him how i and the community helped to have it made, something i and other people would of been proud to talk about the Augmentors Game. My disappointment in how things have turned out, runs deep and painful.   I want to  take this opportunity to apologise to every who I talked to about Augmentors, how I was singing its praises and I really did have absolutely faith in the team and project, I thought Augmentors Game was going to be my last ever investment in Crypto and I had a vision of being there to help the team for ever, all FREE of charge, I never asked for nor ever would have asked for anything in return, other than to be kept up to date with the developments so I could help and advise the community to the best of my abilities, as an investor I was more than happy to work for my investment and help any way which i could.    So please accept my sincere apologies. For the record I think the game will be a success when it comes out.   I am sorry to all, who i feel i have let down by not being able to turn things around, i gave everything i could, but in the end, it didn't really matter to The Augmentors Game.   But every cloud has a silver lining right?

Author: bustedsynx
Title: AUGMENTORS GAME Augmented Reality Mobile Gaming iOS Android Token DTB Databits
Body: That's just it. Augmentors was one of the earliest ICOs in early 2017. Communication is never the issue and never will be the issue. It's the amount of work the developers put in. There were many many crypto projects that have silent devs but you can see from their github activity they were all coding all the time, so no worries. In fact, when the platform/product is finally released, the price has already climbed 5x - 10x!  What about Augmentors? Ok, the creature developments were a good sign of progress but then as Vintage said complete silence. That in itself is ominous. So, what's happening? Devs giving up? Too much alcohol in Ibiza? Then the confirmation comes. New team, roadmap pushed back.  Yeah, ok. I'll just hold while these guys take their time as they work leisurely and unprofessionally. This is not fud. You can check their past promises.  IMHO, there is a large chance nothing happens on "second half of 2018". LOL, Android game developers can push out new games in three months! I don't think the gameplay of Augmentors is that complex to take almost a year with nothing to show.  Furthermore, it's all excuses and excuses. This has happened before. Don't fall into the trap that "This time it will be different".  Fucking amateurs passing off as revolutionary game devs. Sell and take profits while you can. If wrong, ok. I missed out on great profit. But what if I'm right? Is that disposable income you invested?

Author: Febo
Title: AUGMENTORS GAME Augmented Reality Mobile Gaming iOS Android Token DTB Databits
Body: Fridays update from AUGMENTORS team   Dear Augmentors backers,  The Augmentors team has been hard at work and we have exciting news and important updates that we’d like to share.  The Augmentors creators and founders (Michael Deon and Kyle Haffenden) have realised that in order to achieve their vision for Augmentors they need to focus their attention on game creation. Realizing this, and in collaboration with the Augmentors advisors, they have brought a CEO on board to support and guide Augmentors to greatness.  We’re thrilled to announce that Gert Kruger (https://www.linkedin.com/in/gert-kruger-19b04b7/) has joined the Augmentors team as CEO. Gert has a technical and engineering background, and brings a wealth of business expertise. He is an avid gamer and we are very excited to have him on board. We’ll make sure that you get to know Gert a little better in the coming months.   The Augmentors white paper has been finalized and will be made available to you as soon as possible. The delay is due to a patent investigation that is currently underway to protect the value of the game, databits and the unique way that databits will be used in-game. Hopefully, this will be another world-first.  Following extensive market research, we’ve realised that Slack is not an appropriate gaming community channel and this Slack group is thus not where we will build our primary gaming audience. This channel serves as a medium of communication between ICO backers, databit holders and the Augmentors team.  Significant marketing progress has been made and we have a clearly defined target audience. To ensure that we get valuable and actionable feedback during Alpha we need our target audience to be our Alpha testers. We will build a community for Alpha (using Facebook) and will confirm an official Alpha date soon. We would love for all of you to get involved, if you don’t already, ‘like’ us on Facebook.   The Augmentors team is completely focused on producing a world-class, globally successful game. This in turn will create long-term value and growth for Augmentors and databits. We realise that some of our backers in this Slack community are short term traders and we would like to clarify our position on databits. We are not focused on the day to day price of databits nor on short term price hyping. We are focused on long-term value and hope you will join us for this exciting journey.  All long-term backers can add huge value in the coming months by helping us to promote the game. We know that you’re just as passionate about Augmentors as we are and we will need your help. We will call on willing backers for marketing and promotional support, watch this space for more details on how you can get involved.  Have a great weekend, keep battling!  The Augmentors Team

Author: Febo
Title: AUGMENTORS GAME Augmented Reality Mobile Gaming iOS Android Token DTB Databits
Body: This was posted as Fridays update on Slack.   #FAQFriday  Hi Our fellow Augmentor Trainers.  As always we would like to make the FAQ Friday a post that will help you end off your week on a positive note.  Question : Will the game change a lot from what was originally seen during the ICO?  Answer: Augmentors Game will still be the best AR Game based on the Blockchain, allowing players to truly own their creatures and to train/nurture them to become the best in the field. We like to refer to our creatures as pets that everyone can carry around with them. Let them become your companion!! Changes will be made to the Game as we continue to get feedback from our community during Alpha and Beta tests. We are continuously seeking new technology to incorporate into our game to provide the ultimate gaming experience when playing Augmentors.  Have a awesome weekend everyone

Author: Mlich
Title: AUGMENTORS GAME Augmented Reality Mobile Gaming iOS Android Token DTB Databits
Body: Hi All  Sorry for not being as active on BitcoinTalk as we should have been. We will make sure we are on this thread daily answering any Questions.  We have successfully Burnt all unsold tokens from the ICO as promised. I have attached the PR release we sent out on our Slack channel with regards to the Burn!!   "Dear all ICO backers and the wider Augmentors community  Here is the update as promised: we will burn all unsold Databits from the 70,000,000 allocated for the ICO. Further to this, Augmentors will be burning our original stake of 30 000 000 down to a 70 / 30 ratio. We have worked hard to verify these numbers and we are confident in them.  Total allocated to public – 15 923 466 DTB Total Allocated to Augmentors – 6 824 342.5 DTB Total in Circulation – 22 747 808.5 DTB  BURN – 77 252 191.5  Burn will happen within the next two hours.  The team is very excited about what we have in store and we are running another pre-alpha this weekend! This is due to further overwhelming interest. We are excited and will share more once we have feedback."    I am here to answer any questions you may have  Cheers guys  Augmentors Team (Kyle)

Author: Febo
Title: AUGMENTORS GAME Augmented Reality Mobile Gaming iOS Android Token DTB Databits
Body: Hi backers,  We’ve got an exciting update that we’d like to share with you.  The team has been hard at work to produce a playable version of Augmentors by the end of this week, and we are incredibly proud of the progress we’ve made. Before we get into the details we’d like to tell you about some other exciting news.  We’re thrilled to announce that Marshall Long, the Managing Partner of Mockit eSports, has joined us in an advisory capacity. Marshall has extensive experience helping gaming studios produce and market world-class eSports games. We are absolutely delighted that he has chosen to partner with us.  Marshall has reviewed the game and is very happy with the progress we have made. As per his recommendation we’ve decided to release the current version of the game as a pre-alpha to selected eSports specialists and of course a few of you. The aim is to get early-on constructive feedback from pre-alpha testers. If you’re one of the lucky ones… get ready for an exclusive pre-alpha play of the game this weekend, which will give you a taste of the game to come. Pre-alpha players will be notified by Friday and we cannot wait to share our hard work with you.   To re-confirm, we are still on track for a final release of Augmentors in early 2018 and as promised will burn our Databits hold down to 30% on 15th June 2017.  Cheers,  The Augmentors Team

Author: Geenstijl
Title: AUGMENTORS GAME Augmented Reality Mobile Gaming iOS Android Token DTB Databits
Body: Dear all ICO backers and the wider Augmentors community,   You have made it possible for us to realise our dream of developing Augmentors, a ground-breaking AR game. Over the last few weeks, we’ve received a few requests from the community to re-evaluate the economies of Databits. Thank you for reaching out with all your comments and concerns; we’ve taken them all into consideration.   We said during the ICO, we would retain 30,000,000 Databits for use by the company during development of the game. After the ICO, and after the feedback received from our backers, we considered and debated whether the current agreement is in the the best interests of our most important stakeholder, our backers.   After  studying several options to determine the best way of adjusting the Databits allocation so as to  ensure that all stakeholders are correctly incentivised, this is our final decision on Databit allocation:   1.   As described during the ICO, we will burn all unsold Databits from the 70,000,000 allocated for the ICO. During the ICO, we sold 15,217,819 DTB and thus, the remaining 54 782 181 Databits will be burnt.1 2.   The company will reduce our Databit holding to 30% of total Databits in circulation and not the previously advertised 30,000,000 Databits. Thus, the company will retain 6,521,922 Databits.1 3.   This means that the total number of unburnt Databits will be 15 217 819 (from Backers) and 6 521 922 (from the Company) or 21,739,741 Databits and the total number of Databits to be burnt will be 78,260,259 Databits.1   We believe that this action will protect the interests of our community and that stakeholders’ interests are aligned. Backers will now control 70% of the market cap of Databits. Furthermore, as a company, we are confident that we can execute the development, marketing and launch of the game using the ICO funds and remaining 6,521,922 DTB.1   In terms of process, all outstanding Databits earned during the ICO will be distributed prior to the 1st of April, as indicated in the terms and conditions. The bounty campaign Databits will be distributed over a 3-month interval starting on the 1st of April. Lastly, once all Databits have been successfully distributed, the outstanding Databits will be burnt. An update with more details will be released closer to the time.   Thank you once again for all the support you have shown us. We look forward to sharing an update on the progress of Alpha’s development soon.   Many thanks,   The Augmentors Team

Author: Mlich
Title: AUGMENTORS GAME Augmented Reality Mobile Gaming iOS Android Token DTB Databits
Body: Dear all ICO backers and the wider Augmentors community,  You have made it possible for us to realise our dream to develop Augmentors, a ground-breaking AR game. Over the last few weeks, we’ve received a few requests from the community to re-evaluate the economies of Databits. Thank you for reaching out with all your comments and concerns; we’ve taken them all into consideration.  We said during the ICO, we would retain 30,000,000 Databits for use by the company during development of the game. After the ICO, and after the feedback received from our backers, we considered and debated whether the current agreement is in the the best interests of our important stakeholder, our backers.  After  studying several options to determine the best way of adjusting the Databits allocation so as to  ensure that all stakeholders are correctly incentivised, this is  our final decision on Databit allocation:  As described during the ICO, we will burn all unsold DTB’s from the 70,000,000 allocated for the ICO. During the ICO, we sold 15,217,819 DTB and thus, the remaining 54 782 181 DTB will be burnt. The company will reduce our Databit holding to 30% of total Databits in circulation and not the previously advertised 30,000,000 DTB. Thus, the company will retain 6,521,922 DTB. This means that the total number of unburnt Databits will be 15 217 819 (from Backers) and 6 521 922 (from the Company) or 21,739,741 DTB and the total number of Databits to be burnt will be 78,260,259 DTB.   We believe that this action will protect the interests of our community and that stakeholders’ interests are aligned. Backers will now control 70% of the market cap of Databits. Furthermore, as a company, we are confident that we can execute the development, marketing and launch of the game using the ICO funds and remaining 6,521,922 DTB.  In terms of process, all outstanding DTB’s earned during the ICO will be distributed prior to the 1st of April, as indicated in the terms and conditions. The bounty campaign Databits will be distributed over a 3-month interval starting on the 1st of April. Lastly, once all DTB’s have been successfully distributed, the outstanding Databits will be burnt. An update with more details will be released closer to the time.  Thank you once again for all the support you have shown us. We look forward to sharing an update on the progress of Alpha’s development soon.  Many thanks,  Kyle & Michael

He is best known as co-founder and CEO of Gyft, a mobile gift card company backed by Google. Lingham is a big advocate for Bitcoin, and Gyft was one of the early adopters amongst the businesses to accept Bitcoin as payment.  LinkedIn: http://bit.ly/2jVSqHK  Twitter: @VinnyLingham   Gil Oved Investor Gil Oved is a South African entrepreneur who is the co-founder and co-CEO of The Creative Counsel, South Africa’s largest advertising agency. He is one of the Dragons on the hugely popular television reality show Dragons’ Den South Africa which premiered in the last quarter of 2014 on DSTV. In 2016 Oved was chosen as the first “Shark” on the new series of Shark Tank on M-NET.  LinkedIn: http://bit.ly/2kUt76y  Twitter @gil_oved   Taylor Gibb Developer Taylor is an award winning software developer and international speaker with over 8 years of experience. Ross has developed games on mobile, web, desktop and console and more recently has been focusing on Virtual, Augmented and Mixed reality experiences. Currently Ross is working in a Research and Development team in a large gaming company focusing on building new products on cutting edge hardware and software in the Virtual and mixed reality fields. Ross has won many local and international awards including the Microsoft Imagine Cup South Africa, 2 years in a row, and more recently the 2015 Global Gaming Awards, and the 2016 International Gaming Awards for Innovation of the year. Title: AUGMENTORS GAME Augmented Reality Mobile Gaming iOS Android Token DTB Databits
Body: I have lots and lots of experience with XCP tokens. I don't know any Counterparty compatible wallet for Windows, however IndieSquare is a great XCP mobile wallet. There's no central server with regards to Indiesquare connecting to XCP nodes. You can also use Tokenly.  The browser-based wallet (Counterwallet) uses HD addresses which all your addresses and private keys are derived from the passphrase. You can interchangebly use the same passphrase with Indiesquare. Though I don't know the exact derivation path it uses. Maybe you can find out for us and share here. https://iancoleman.github.io/bip39/ Thanks.

Author: drays
Title: AUGMENTORS GAME Augmented Reality Mobile Gaming iOS Android Token DTB Databits
Body: Folks, don't you think it doesn't sound too good if the team holds about 60-75% of the total supply? It seems to me such a huge percentage kept by single entity is dangerous in many aspects (hacking, misuse etc), and that could present some problem with the exchanges too. I know you will tell the guys are trusted and advised well. But the power creates a temptation to misuse it. I was witnessing such things many times. Also such amounts concentrated in a single place are prone to being hacked. Seen that too. Who are the escrows of dev fund btw?  Does anyone know if there are any plans to burn part of the developers premine, so it presents a certain reasonable percent of the total supply?

Title: AUGMENTORS GAME Augmented Reality Mobile Gaming iOS Android Token DTB Databits
Body: Hello everyone!  851 BTC, we are so close to our goal! We have 6 days left, so make sure to buy a package soon if you want to participate in the ICO.  For people wondering about the development schedule of the game:  Right now, we are scheduled to release an Alpha build of the game at the end of May 2017. Author: Khilone7
Title: AUGMENTORS GAME Augmented Reality Mobile Gaming iOS Android Token DTB Databits
Body: Updates from the team from Slack:  sure, at the moment we are working on the game mechanics for the alpha release. game mechanics are what i think is going to set us apart in this industry. we need players to want to come back and that means we need to incorporate some kind of skill cap. so right now, we are deciding which features we are going to ship in the alpha. we are also looking at the existing code base and seeing what we can use and what needs to be redone.  so we are going to define the initial roadmap of how we think the game should grow, and then i have suggested we get the community involved so they can have a say as well. i am very community driven so one of my top priorities is getting the community involved in shaping the product

Author: CryptoMrM
Title: AUGMENTORS GAME Augmented Reality Mobile Gaming iOS Android Token DTB Databits
Body: Seems like your english isn't very good so trying to understand.  The terms in my opinion are just to protect the founders in any event/outcome. I don't blame them considering people will invest regardless, you might as-well try and protect yourself as best as possible. Likewise a-lot of the stuff was to cover regulatory issues.  As I've said to a-lot of people most ICO's and cryptocurrencies are done on good faith. It's at the core of a-lot of things. I agree you take the risk but that's part of investing. I do see where you're coming from though. Unfortunately or fortunately that's one of the elements of crowdfunding. If you were a VC you'd probably have a-lot more negotiating power.  Likewise I disagree with the binary of it's either going to succeed massively or not. Look at past similar crowd-funds (SoG & Beyond The Void) both relative successes before their products had even come out. Similarly blockchain collectables like "PEPE" haven't even required mass adoption to be a 'success'. In my opinion mass adoption in a global market is just one opportunity for this to be massive but it could easily be a success just amongst the community here (believe it or not). Either through engagement, speculation, hype etc etc. I'm not getting into this publicly, I think people need to wise up a little.

Author: CryptoMrM
Title: AUGMENTORS GAME Augmented Reality Mobile Gaming iOS Android Token DTB Databits
Body: It's not the most widely publicised ICO and therefore I find more small-time investors miss ICO's like this. It also tends to be the 'whales' with enough brains to discern a potential profitable ICO when they see one. Likewise small-time investors are put off by other factors like potential scams and again sadly aren't sometimes able to tell. There's lots of different factors really, including the early notification to SoG investors who were already knowledgable in the area and probably wealthy enough. Could get into it but would probably end up going off on a tangent for ICO's in general.    Well I don't mind posting, I know other 'whales' are deliberately not shouting from the roof-top. Personally I'm hoping for over $1 million of investment so I want to keep awareness up. It would be remiss of me to say the project still represents good value if you get in now or later. I said to someone earlier I don't enter ICO's for 20-30% profit Furthermore the added package incentives such as limited cards can be played to your advantage if you choose the right package/creature. I am bias none the less.  1. It's quite clear to me that the investments are real. In a multitude of ways, not least the fact that if they weren't would imply the whole thing a scam. The escrow address can be viewed here FYI: https://blockchain.info/address/32m58KhzMxYFh5L6UVG6U2ort65snJffP9. I'm also one of the most frequent faces amongst cryptocurrency Slacks (I know it's terrible, but I like to know everything I can), so yes I recognise and know some active big 'whales'. With regards to Bitcointalk activity unfortunately I/we get the feeling the Augmentors team aren't the biggest fans or most experienced of Bitcointalk. This 'issue' has been raised. Likewise as you said people may be keeping quiet for fear of dilution. There may be other reasons too.  2. Of the listed team members two of the developers have years of experience behind them: http://bit.ly/2kfPDrF http://bit.ly/2jW4tov. The founders also have design, branding, management experience and innovation/ambition. Likewise the mentoring of verified, public figures in the two 'shark-tank' investors they have on board. It's quite enough to not have me worrying about such things.  Hope that helps

Author: stereotype
Title: AUGMENTORS GAME Augmented Reality Mobile Gaming iOS Android Token DTB Databits
Body: Well said. Nice observations.  For me, the risk/reward ratio is good on this one, not just for the valid points above, but also because of the work already gone into it, together with the stated intention to release an alpha in 3 months. This is not a game project at the start of its journey. Therefore a large amount of risk has been removed or reduced, already. I would avoid like the plague if this was just starting, as the percentage of newly born game projects that go on to release, is small. Also, it would not be absolutely correct to approach this in the same way as coin release, where extra features, and updates, and news, etc. deciding what value it has at any given time. For me, its binary....it gets released within 6 months, and is used by thousands, or it does not. Stress-free gambling works for me.

Author: drays
Title: AUGMENTORS GAME Augmented Reality Mobile Gaming iOS Android Token DTB Databits
Body: I have few questions, guys. Would appreciate any info, probably I have missed a lot of info on this project.  My first impression on this was - "this is scam". Too many question raised:  1. The game is developed since Mid-2016, but is there any live demo or pre-alpha to look at? Are those developers capable of creating such game? Any info of their previous projects?  2. T&C put all the responsibility on shoulders of investors. Developers guarantee absolutely nothing. So theoretically they can work for a year, spend all the money by getting high wages, and having fun, and then just tell "sorry the public was not interested in the game, and we decided to stop it at alpha stage. No sources, no demo, sorry. Bye". What prevents them from doing that?  3. The ICO progress doesnt seem to be traceable. Is there a way to check whether all those money were really invested?  But then I saw few BCT old-timers here backing this project, and I actually know and respect some of them... So my question is - what do I miss here? What makes you guys think this project is not just another money grab? Any links to info which makes you think the team is real, capable and is actually intending to complete this? Is it just the "famous" South African investors, who make you believe this project? As far as I can see they invested way less than crowdfunding goal is, so they may be a "part of the deal"..?     EDIT: see what is happening at Ascendancy ICO thread...! And they had actual escrows, who are responsive to Bitcointalk community, unlike this project! If something happens, will those "real-world" escrows give a shit to Bitcointalk backers? Dont think so... Its like MASS ICO with Mr.Kuzmin declared as initial escrow - now he just dont give a f**k about investors! Crazy.

Author: drays
Title: AUGMENTORS GAME Augmented Reality Mobile Gaming iOS Android Token DTB Databits
Body: Its easy to start overthinking when you see what happens on some ICOs, like Ascendancy, or Nodio. Or take the MASS Network project, which I actually invested in. Brilliant, well-thought idea presented in whitepaper with all kinds of real-world advisors involved. I personally had extremely high hopes to it, was excited to the extend I even recommended it to some people, which I typically never do. Now their ICO is over, the half of the team has silently left, and they left people wondering if there is anybody still working on the project... That specific case raised my internal FUD susceptibility a lot    I hope this one is different. Funny, Lingham invested 50 BTC for 20%, now they ask more than 1000 BTC for 70%, so Lingham had more than 5x bonus already compared to us regular investors. Not bad The T&C may be standard for ICOs here (I dont know actually), but they sound really bad and are unacceptable for real world business investors, as at least commitment should be made for actually producing a working software, even if it's not popular. I cannot imagine a serious businessman providing money to some team, with them promicing him nothing back, except their "reasonable efforts".  And now that "-20%" penaltybonus for everyone who is few days late.. I would say, the promotion of this project and ICO schedule sucks badly. But the project itself is still interesting.  Anyway, thanks a lot for your replies guys (especially MrWhiteBites). I'll look once again at info on website (the Shark Tank video does not play though), though it didnt impress me yesterday when looking into it. Sincerely I think what actually gave you the confidence is chatting with developers on Slack...

Author: CryptoMrM
Title: AUGMENTORS GAME Augmented Reality Mobile Gaming iOS Android Token DTB Databits
Body: Hi Everyone,  Happy to be backing this project. I know for a fact a-lot of people currently involved aren't talking/bumping the subject too much because they don't want to dilute their share.  I feel obliged to at-least post once on the ICO thread  You'll have to excuse the rather silly bitcointalk and bounty related issues. It's my understanding the directors don't have much experience on bitcointalk and that's the reasons for those issues. Trust me, I don't like to see them either.  One the main things I liked about the project was the economic model that actually gives some real value/utility to the crypto token (50% of fiat revenues is converted to DTB and then burned forever).  Likewise the mention of reputable investors in the space puts my mind at ease.  Downsides are it's a little rough around the edges and the game itself has to work. However as it's already raised over $500k and increasing today I can see it easily reaching it's $1million target. As a backer/trader I think just over $1million would be the optimum amount I would want it to raise. Whilst I understand people don't want them raising too much as it dilutes their own holdings it does come with several benefits such as: more resources to complete the game, increased expectation/necessity to produce a quality game & actually dilutes the influence/risk of the remaining development/bounty funds whilst actually increasing their worth/capability.  I am fortunate enough that I have made a profit in every ICO I have entered so far. Just waiting for some bad luck now  Anyway pop over to the Slack and join the Augmentors community today!  Ben

Author: coin-investor
Title: AUGMENTORS GAME Augmented Reality Mobile Gaming iOS Android Token DTB Databits
Body: Before you invest,be sure that you read their sale tos so you will not be surprise in case the dev  suddenly stop this  project,the tos guaranty their profit,but di not guaranty it's investors Quote 3.1. The Purchaser acknowledges and understands that the Databits have no warranty whatsoever, expressed or implied, to the extent permitted by Applicable Law and accordingly that Databits are purchased on an "as is" basis. 3.2. The Purchaser also understands that K will not provide any refund of the purchase price for Databits under any circumstance. 3.3. The Purchaser further agrees to accept sole and exclusive risk for the purchase of Databits through the Augmentors Realm. The Purchaser recognises that the Augmentors game is currently being developed and may undergo significant changes before release. 3.4. In order to reduce the possibility of fraud, phishing attempts and other schemes perpetrated by malicious third parties, the Purchaser agrees not to respond directly to any inquiry regarding its purchase of Databits, including but not limited to email requests purportedly coming from K, its affiliates or the Augmentors Realm. The Purchaser understands that K may send the Purchaser emails from time-to-time, but these email notices will never ask for information or require a response from the Purchaser. 3.5. The Purchaser understands, that while K and its affiliates will make reasonable efforts to complete the development of the Augmentors game, there is a possibility that an officially completed version of the Augmentors game may not be released and there may never be an operational Augmentors game. 3.6. It may also occur that even if K releases a completed version of the Augmentors game, the game may potentially be abandoned or shut down due to a lack of public interest in games of this nature or the Augmentors game in particular. 3.7. The Purchaser also recognises that K does not warrant the period of time for which the Augmentors game will be operational. The Augmentors game may be abandoned by K for a number of reasons, including a lack of interest from the public, a lack of funding or competing games that seek to develop similar products,

Author: MichaelDeon
Title: AUGMENTORS GAME Augmented Reality Mobile Gaming iOS Android Token DTB Databits
Body: AUGMENTORS Augmented Reality Battle GAME    Augmented Reality games are going to evolve the future of gaming and Augmentors Team are working on developing the Best augmented reality game for android, IOS and Mobile devices worldwide.  Let us introduce to you Augmentors Game.  A new dimension in gaming has arrived. Unseen by many, controlled by the highest-ranking DESTINED, it’s where reality and illusion collide as you summon your creatures into the real world to do your bidding.  Only the strongest succeed as you trade, sell and buy creatures, relics and potions in the battle to be the best of the best!  Official Website - Packed with lots of information.    www.augmentorsgame.com  Meet The Team   https://www.augmentorsgame.com/meet-the-augmentors-team/  WHITE PAPER  DATABITS ECONOMY DESIGN 2.0 – WHITEPAPER  https://www.augmentorsgame.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/06/25052018-DatabitsWhitepaper-v2.1.2.pdf  Important: You Tube recording of our Webinar explaining the white paper in more detail (Must View)  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oXe9qp1e4ws  TOKEN SALE AND PRE SALE (ICO)  Augmentors raised $1 million USD (895 BTC) during the 30-day token sale, which ended in February 2017. At the time, it was the most successful token sale ever conducted by a mobile video game project and it was also the first token sale conducted in South Africa.  We created 100 million Databits in total for fundraising and the exchange for 1 Bitcoin (BTC) was 15 000 Databits (DTB).  23 million (22,747,809) Databits were issued during the token sale and the remaining 77 million (77,252,191) were burnt.  Of the 22,747,809 Databits issued, 70% was utilised in the token sale crowdfunding campaign and the remaining 30% will be used to fund the development of the game, to create awareness and for promotion.  Augmentors also did a pre-sale exclusive with Spells of Genesis where we released a limited edition Augmentor,  Genesis of Light, which would not be available at any other time. Out of the 1000 available to supporters,  67 were sold, 20 were sent to Spells of Genesis owners, and 913 units were ‘burnt’.  Those who supported the Augmentors project received a special portion of Databits, and a selection of rare,  one-of-a-kind creatures relating to the size of their contribution. For the token sale, 25 of the 50 total creatures were allocated and are never to be re-released. Those who purchased more Databits received higher level Augmentors,  such as Champion, Ultimate, Hero, Villain, and god status. The only way to obtain these rare creatures now  is through a trade or sale with another player. Token sale participants will be able to select their rare, one-of-a-kind creatures before game release.  TERMS AND CONDITIONS  Augmentors token sale – Sales agreement   https://www.augmentorsgame.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/170130.cln-Augmentor-ICO-Sale-Agreement.pdf  Augmentors token sale – Terms and conditions  https://www.augmentorsgame.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/170130.cln-Augmentor-ICO-TCs.pdf    PARTNER, PREMIUM AND PUBLIC CREATURE STORES  During the token sale some participants received partner and premium store access for their contribution. Premium and public Augmentors creatures, relics and skins will first be made available to these participants  in the partner and premium store before remaining assets move to the public store.  PARTNER STORE (PLATINUM PACKAGE)  The partner store will offer public and premium creatures, relics & skins (assets) for Databits. All the public and premium  assets will be first available at the partner store. One month later they will then be offered on the premium or the public store.  70% of the total supply of each public asset and 30% of the total supply of each premium asset will be available  at the partner store. Each package is subject to discounted rates depending on the package bought.  PREMIUM STORE (GOLD AND DIAMOND PACKAGE)  The premium store will offer 50% of the total supply of the premium assets. Those will be available one month after the asset release on the partner store. Each asset will be on sale for a week. If there is any stock left,  it may reappear later. Augmentors will keep 20% of the total supply of each asset. For the assets produced  in partnership with another project, Augmentors reserves the right to allocate a reasonable amount of the asset supply (out of the 20% kept by Augmentors) to the partner project. Each package is subject to discounted rates depending on the package bought.  PUBLIC CREATURE STORE  The public store will sell public blockchain creatures, relics and skins for Databits and distribute free assets , including free creatures, relics and skins. The public assets will be available approximately a month after  their release on the partner store. The number of assets available for sale will be limited for each sale.  All items will be sold using flash sales, lasting a few hours or days.   DATABITS (DTB) AND WHERE TO trade  once the game has been released will be able to use their Databits to purchase creatures, relics and skins.   Databits (DTB) can be traded on Bittrex.  https://i.imgur.com/kAAthGq.jpg  https://bittrex.com/Market/Index?MarketName=BTC-DTB  and also the new and extremely easy to use  Coinswitch (buy DTB without signing up to exchanges!)  https://i.imgur.com/lH5oe3n.jpg  https://coinswitch.co/#   Join Our Community Here:  DISCORD: https://discord.gg/n6gbcm8  TELEGRAM: https://t.me/augmentorsgame  TWITTER: https://twitter.com/AugmentorsGame  FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/augmentors  REDDIT: https://www.reddit.com/r/AugmentorsGame/   YOUTUBE: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgVMOJzZRU_6ZKW-OthznSw    NEWS AND UPDATES:  Please Bookmark and Read our Weekly Medium Blog posts  https://medium.com/augmentors
